member.name: T:Rhino.DSL.BlockToArgumentsTransformer
member.summary:
Transforms the contents of macro blocks specified in the ctor to parameters.
mymacro: 1 "something"
is transformed into
mymacro(1, "something")

member.param: Methods that should have blocks transformed into arguments.

member.summary: Handles macro statements.

member.summary: Takes all macro statements that exist in the modules global section and puts the bodies of those methods into corresponding overridable methods on the base class.

member.summary: Create an instance of MethodSubstitutionBaseClassCompilerStep

member.summary: Extends the base class by placing the blocks of macros into methods on the base class of the same name.

member.name: T:Rhino.DSL.TransformerCompilerStep
member.summary: Compiler step to run s.
member.remarks: This is a useful way to apply one or more transformers as a compiler step.

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.TransformerCompilerStep.#ctor(Boo.Lang.Compiler.Ast.DepthFirstTransformer[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of TransformerCompilerStep.
member.param: Transformers for this compiler step to run.
member.exception: should have at least one element.

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.TransformerCompilerStep.Run
member.summary: Run the .

member.name: T:Rhino.DSL.UnderscoreNamingConventionsToPascalCaseCompilerStep
member.summary: Allow to use underscore separated names, which will be translated to pascal case names. pascal_case -> PascalCase. All names that contains an underscores will go through this treatment.
member.example:
You can enable this behavior using the following statement
compiler.Parameters.Pipeline .InsertBefore(typeof (ProcessMethodBodiesWithDuckTyping), new UnderscoreNamingConventionsToPascalCaseCompilerStep());

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.UnderscoreNamingConventionsToPascalCaseCompilerStep.OnReferenceExpression(Boo.Lang.Compiler.Ast.ReferenceExpression)
member.summary: Called when we encounter a reference expression

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.UnderscoreNamingConventionsToPascalCaseCompilerStep.ShouldTransformNodeName(Boo.Lang.Compiler.Ast.ReferenceExpression)
member.summary: Determain if the the name of the node should be transformed.

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.UnderscoreNamingConventionsToPascalCaseCompilerStep.OnMemberReferenceExpression(Boo.Lang.Compiler.Ast.MemberReferenceExpression)
member.summary: Called when we encounters a member reference expression

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.UnderscoreNamingConventionsToPascalCaseCompilerStep.TransformNodeName(Boo.Lang.Compiler.Ast.ReferenceExpression)
member.summary: Sets the node name to pascal case.

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.UnderscoreNamingConventionsToPascalCaseCompilerStep.Run
member.summary: Start visiting the current compile unit

member.name: T:Rhino.DSL.UseSymbolsStep
member.summary: Translate all @foo reference expression to "foo" string literals. In essense, add symbols to the language

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.UseSymbolsStep.Run
member.summary: Runs this instance.

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.UseSymbolsStep.OnReferenceExpression(Boo.Lang.Compiler.Ast.ReferenceExpression)
member.summary: Called when visting a reference expression. Will turn reference expressions with initial @ to string literals

member.name: T:Rhino.DSL.AutoImportCompilerStep
member.summary: Automatically imports all the specified namespaces to all the modules in the compilation unit
member.remarks: This probably belongs early in the compilation process

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.AutoImportCompilerStep.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.AutoImportCompilerStep.Run
member.summary: Runs this instance.

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.AutoImportCompilerStep.OnModule(Boo.Lang.Compiler.Ast.Module)
member.summary: Add the namespaces to the module

member.name: T:Rhino.DSL.UrlResolverDelegate
member.summary: This delegate is used to abstract getting the data from a url. This allows us to plug in more smarts when needed (for instance, hooking into the Castle.Resources system)

member.name: T:Rhino.DSL.AutoReferenceFilesCompilerStep
member.summary:
This compiler step will auotmatically compiler and reference all files specified in import clauses such as: import file from "[file name]"
Another option is: import namespaces from "[file name]"
In which case all the namespaces defined in that file will be imported into the current file

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.AutoReferenceFilesCompilerStep.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new instance of

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.AutoReferenceFilesCompilerStep.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance of
member.param: The base directory to resolve files from

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.AutoReferenceFilesCompilerStep.#ctor(Rhino.DSL.UrlResolverDelegate)
member.summary: Create a new instance of

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.AutoReferenceFilesCompilerStep.#ctor(System.String,Rhino.DSL.UrlResolverDelegate)
member.summary: Create a new instance of
member.param: The base directory to resolve files from

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.AutoReferenceFilesCompilerStep.OnImport(Boo.Lang.Compiler.Ast.Import)
member.summary: Add the desired import behavior.

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.AutoReferenceFilesCompilerStep.SafeCloneParameters(Boo.Lang.Compiler.CompilerParameters)
member.summary: This creates a copy of the passed compiler parameters, without the stuff that make a compilation unique, like input, output assembly, etc

member.name: M:Rhino.DSL.AutoReferenceFilesCompilerStep.Run
member.summary: Run the current compiler step
